content.description: Which of the following methods can be used to find the derivative of <math alttext="y equals, the arc cosine of, open parenthesis, the square root of x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>arccos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>⁡</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
content.question: Use the quotient rule to differentiate <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator the cosine of, open parenthesis, the square root of x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.Use the chain rule to differentiate <math alttext="the cosine of, open parenthesis, the arc cosine of, the square root of x, close parenthesis, equals the square root of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>arccos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>.Use implicit differentiation to differentiate the function <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the relation <math alttext="cosine y, equals the square root of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
